member.name: T:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun
member.summary: Interface for using VECTO via the API in the OEM's application

member.name: P:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.WriteModData
member.summary: enables/disables writing of modal data disabled by default

member.name: P:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.ValidateInput
member.summary: enables/disables validation of the input data can be used for speeding up the creation of all simulation runs

member.name: P:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.WaitFinished
member.summary: enable/disable a blocking call to RunSimulation by default RunSimulation is blocking

member.name: M:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.RunSimulation
member.summary: execut the simulation may throw an AggregateException if WaitFinished is true

member.name: M:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.GetProgress
member.summary: get the progress of all simulation runs. the key is unique per simulation job

member.name: M:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.WaitSimulationFinished
member.summary: blocking wait for all simulation runs to be completed (only useful if the call to RunSimulation has been set to be non-blocking (see Waitfinished) may throw an AggregateException When running the simulation non-blocking (i.e., Waitfinished is false) this method _has to_ be called to re-throw any excpetions from the simulation tasks (otherwise inspect the ProgressEntries from GetProgess)

member.name: P:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.IsFinished
member.summary: returns true if all simulation runs are completed

member.name: P:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.XMLManufacturerReport
member.summary: get the XML containing the Manufacturer Report only valid after the simulation is finished

member.name: P:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.XMLCustomerReport
member.summary: get the XML containing the Customer Report only valid after the simulation is finished

member.name: P:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.SumEntries
member.summary: Get the entries written to the .vsum file

member.name: M:TUGraz.VectoAPI.IVectoApiRun.ModData(System.Int32)
member.summary: get the modal data of a simulation run. the runId is the identifier of the simulation run within the current job (see also the keys in GetProgess
